noun.description: A serious bacterial disease of sheep and cattle, typically affecting the skin and lungs. It can be transmitted to humans, causing severe skin ulceration (malignant pustule) or a form of pneumonia (wool-sorters' disease).

origin: Late Middle English: Latin, carbuncle (the earliest sense in English), from Greek anthrax, anthrak- coal, carbuncle, with reference to the skin ulceration in humans.
